page.title: 20LOCAL HISTORY-Public Houses
page.content: We interviewed{Dixie Dean,}(one of the senior members of the village), about {"Public Houses".} He was l8 when he first went into a pub and he enjoyed it. There were many different kinds of entertainment including{crib, cards, billiards, {darts and dominoes. }The only thing he likes about pubs nowadays is the food. He doesn't like the beer pumps and of course the prices. Dixie Dean's uncle, with a little beer in the bottom of his glass, would say to him "Drink up my boy". It was bad manners to refuse. But if you could not give him an empty glass back you had to buy him another pint. In the pubs there would be lots of fights about football (especially when they were drunk). Dixie Dean even got into a fight himself, in his younger days of course.
